FuncDef:
The ip-pool warning-threshold command sets an alarm threshold for the address usage of the IPv4 address pools bound to a VPN instance so that the NE40E generates an alarm when the IPv4 address usage reaches the threshold.
The undo ip-pool warning-threshold command restores the default configuration.
By default, the alarm threshold for the address usage of an IPv4 address pool is 80%.
ParentView: VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an alarm threshold for the IPv4 address usage, in percentage. For example, the value 80 indicates that the NE40E generates an alarm when the address usage of the IPv4 address pool reaches 80%.The value 0 indicates that the alarm function is disabled.
The value ranges from 0 to 100.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set an alarm threshold for the address usage of the IPv4 address pools bound to a VPN instance, run the ip-pool warning-threshold command so that the NE40E generates an alarm when the IPv4 address usage reaches the threshold. This prompts the administrator to plan addresses to prevent user login failures due to address exhaustion.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
